intro: Monocera grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered monocera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
